documents.title: wooden wonder
text: a japanese company is planning to build the world 's tallest wooden skyscraper , to mark its 350th anniversary in 2041 .

sumitomo forestry said10 % of the 70-storey w350 tower would be steel , combined with about 180,000 cubic metres of indigenous wood , enough to build about 8,000 homes , and trees and foliage on balconies at every level .
a `` braced tube structure '' , diagonal steel vibration-control braces at the centre of a 350m ( 1,150ft ) wood and steel column , would protect against tokyo 's regular earthquakes , it said .
the projected cost of the building is about 600bn yen ( £ 4.02bn ) - about twice the cost of a conventional skyscraper of the same size .
but sumitomo said it expected costs to fall before completion due to technological breakthroughs .

documents.title: mark carney : 'bitcoin has failed as a currency '
text: bank of england governor mark carney says the crypto-currency bitcoin has failed as a currency , when measured by traditional benchmarks .
`` it has pretty much failed thus far on the traditional aspects of money , '' mr carney told students at london 's regent 's university .
`` it is not a store of value because it is all over the map .
nobody uses it as a medium of exchange . ''

documents.title: uber suspends services in morocco
text: ride-hailing app taxi company uber has suspended its service in morocco over an ongoing debate with lawmakers .
morocco only has laws in place governing conventional taxis , but no provisions for private hire vehicles .
since we launched in morocco over two years ago , there has been a lack of clarity about new platforms like uber and how they fit into the existing transport model , '' uber said in a statement .
`` despite consistent dialogue we have yet to see any constructive progress on the regulations and can safely say we have exhausted all measures . ''

the invitation to dinner was made via a full-page advert , which ran as the front cover of several indian newspapers over the weekend .
it featured a of trump jr together with text : `` trump is here .
are you invited ? ''

have you ? ''

he said his itinerary was designed to steer clear of politics but is listed as a keynote speaker at a global business conference , which will be attended by indian politicians including prime minister narendra modi .

documents.title: deutsche bank to cut at least 250 investment banking jobs
text: deutsche bank is to cut up to 500 investment banking jobs , with 250 initially earmarked to go , sources have told reuters .
cuts are likely to be made in various deutsche offices including london , birmingham , the us and asia-pacific .

deutsche reported that revenues in its investment bank fell 15 % to €14.23bn last year , while compensation and benefits rose 8 % to €4.26bn , despite a pledge by chief executive john cryan not to pay bonuses last year .
he has since reversed that policy , putting pressure on the bank to find other ways of cutting costs .

documents.title: historic knitwear factory closes after 120 years
text: a historic textiles factory has closed after more than 120 years due to `` increased competition .
balmoral knitwear in east ayrshire , which opened in 1895 , has announced it is going through liquidation and will no longer continue the manufacturing side of its business .
its galston-based factory will close , meaning the loss of 43 jobs in the production of work attire and school uniforms .
balmoral knitwear provide school jumpers to thomas 's school in battersea , attended by prince george .

`` the need for organisations to reduce costs and seek the lowest possible price for goods , often from overseas , has led to another blow for the scottish knitwear industry , '' said provisional liquidators rsm .
`` the balmoral name is well known in the sector and we would ask any parties with an interest in acquiring the business to get in touch with us as soon as possible . ''

documents.title: london closes on a low
text: london shares have closed lower .

the ftse 100 fell 0.7 % or 49.8 points to 7,244.91 , dragged down by reckitt benckiser group , which fell 7.2 % to £ 60.98 after the consumer goods firm announced profit margins that were lower than expectations and a warning that margins could continue to be hit in 2018 .
meanwhile , the ftse 250 slipped 0.4 % or 76 points to 19,657.65 .
the losers were led by british cybersecurity firm sophos group , falling 5.6 % to 502.9p despite reporting strong growth globally .

documents.title: would cutting tuition fees help poorer graduates ?
text: the claim : cutting tuition fees for university students without changing anything else would make the system less progressive .

reality check verdict : if no other parts of the system were changed , a simple cut in tuition fees would not help those lower-income graduates who would not repay their loans within 30 years and would help higher-income graduates who would repay them .
read more here .

documents.title: how many kfc restaurants are closed ?
text: kfc has just told the bbc that 338 of its 900 restaurants in the uk are now open .
just to recap - earlier the fast food chain announced that it had to close 750 outlets today after delivery problems meant they ran out of chicken .
last week , the fried chicken chain switched its delivery contract to dhl , which blamed `` operational issues '' for the supply disruption .

documents.title: arsenal and emirates in £ 200m shirt sponsorship extension
text: premier league football club arsenal and airline emirates have signed a five-year extension to their long-running shirt sponsorship deal .
the size of the deal is believed to be in excess of £ 200m ( $ 280m ) .
the emirates name will feature on the shirts and kit of all arsenal teams until the end of the 2023-24 season .
it is the largest sponsor deal signed by the london club , and will see the emirates shirt partnership , which began in 2006 , run to at least 18 years .

documents.title: cash isa savings rates begin to tick up
text: interest rates on cash individual savings accounts ( isas ) are beginning to rise , bringing a little relief for savers .
returns on average instant access isas increased from 0.68 % in december to 0.78 % in february , according to the data provider moneyfacts .
for fixed-rate isas of at least 18 months , rates went up from 1.38 % in december to 1.46 % this month .
savers have until april to use their 2017-18 isa allowances .

documents.title: egyptian firm buying $ 15bn in israeli natural gas
text: egyptian firm dolphinus holdings has signed a $ 15bn deal to purchase 64 billion cubic metres of natural gas from two israeli gas fields over the next decade .
israel considers this to be the most significant export deal with egypt since the two countries signed the historic peace treaty in 1979 .
israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu said the agreements would `` strengthen our economy ( and ) strengthen regional ties '' .

documents.title: probe after 'drone made helicopter crash '
text: investigations have been launched after a helicopter reportedly crashed after swerving to avoid a consumer drone in the us .
a trainee had been practising hovering about 15m ( 50ft ) above trees on daniel island , south carolina , reported the charleston post and courier newspaper quoting a police report .
there are grave concerns in the drone industry that irresponsible use of consumer drones could end up scuppering innovation for the commercial industry if drones are banned from being flown at all .

industry groups representing large us airlines , pilots and air-traffic controllers have previously urged the us federal aviation administration ( faa ) to end exemptions that currently prevent it from regulating consumer drones .

documents.title: black panther movie big in south korea
text: marvel studio 's latest superhero film , black panther , has brought in $ 361m ( £ 257.1m ) on its opening weekend .
us audiences contributed the most to that figure but south korea topped the international markets , contributing $ 25.3m , as the film includes scenes shot in the country 's port city of busan .
director ryan coogler told the bbc in february that he had never worked on a film where people had been so excited about it , even before cameras had started to roll .
it is the first marvel superhero film with a predominantly black cast .

documents.title: ftse still flat
text: the ftse 100 remains little changed this afternoon .
it 's currently down 0.3 % at 7,276.67 .
reckitt benckiser , whose shares are still almost 7 % lower , is holding onto its position as the biggest loser on the index .
evraz is the biggest winner , trading almost 4 % higher , after it announced a new long term deal with russian railways .

documents.title: inflation and wage growth not so important : jp morgan
text: equity strategists at jp morgan reckon a rise in inflation and wage growth should not be seen as a `` clear negative '' for equities .
mislav matejka , global equity strategist with the firm , says it is the outlook for both production and sales volumes rather than higher wages that determine the impact on profitability .
the investment firm remains positive on shares saying in a note : `` equities provide a natural hedge against inflation as they produce nominal earnings and sales growth . ''

documents.title: activist hedge fund takes merlin stake
text: activist hedge fund valueact has taken a stake in the london eye and madame tussauds owner merlin entertainments .
valueact 's 5.4 % stake means that it is now merlin 's third largest shareholder .
the american hedge fund has previously pushed for change at firms such as rolls-royce and insurance brokerage willis towers watson .
in october , merlin , which also owns the legoland theme parks and alton towers , said recent terrorist attacks as well as bad weather had hit visitor numbers .
the leisure group is due to publish its full-year results next week .

documents.title: 266 jobs lost after meat supplier goes bust
text: troubled meat wholesaler russell hume has gone into administration with kpmg appointed as administrators .
last month the derby firm was forced to recall meat it had supplied to a number of hotels , restaurants and pubs across the uk.over food hygiene concerns .
the company supplied some of the country 's best known food providers , including british airways , wetherspoon and jamie 's italian .
it operated from six production sites in liverpool , birmingham , london , boroughbridge , exeter and fife and employed a total of 302 people .

administrator chris pole said : the recent product recall and halt in operations has caused significant customer attrition and trading difficulties , which in turn has led the directors to take the decision to place the company into administration .
`` regrettably , with little prospect of production restarting on site , a total of 266 people have been made redundant . ''

documents.title: merlin on the up
text: times business reporter dominic walsh tweets :
shares of merlin entertainments on the move - up 2 % - after us-based activist investor valueact declares 5.4 % stake .

documents.title: supreme court to rule on plumber 's fight for workers ' rights
text: when is a plumber a worker and when is a plumber a contractor ?
we 'll find out after tomorrow when the supreme court considers the case of gary smith .

he worked for pimlico plumbers for five years from 2005 and has already won a number of court rulings that determined he could claim `` worker '' status even though he was described in his contract as `` self-employed operative '' .
the court of appeal said mr smith was a worker because he was required to use the firm 's van for assignments and was contractually obliged to do a minimum number of hours a week .
pimlico plumbers is appealing against the decision .

documents.title: ftse falls slightly on the day
text: the ftse is down 0.15 % on the day falling to 7,284.11 at noon .
leading the losers was reckitt benckiser , which fell 3,521 points or 5.34 % .
but in a relatively flat market evraz was up 2.2 % and standard life aberdeen up 2.17 % .

documents.title: airbnb to clamp down on temporary brothels
text: airbnb says that it is working with a charity to stop traffickers turning home rentals into brothels , according to sky news .

it reports that the company is collaborating with polaris , the anti-trafficking charity , to train employees and to find new ways of spotting signs that women and girls are being sexually exploited .
mps last year set up an inquiry into the growth of temporary brothels across the uk , including areas such as the lake district .

nick shapiro , global head of trust and risk management at airbnb , told the thomson reuters foundation : `` exploitation and trafficking are still all too common in today 's society , but we are eager to use our global reach to help assist in the effort to end it once and for all . ''

documents.title: what not to expect from hammond statement
text: there wo n't be a red box in the chancellor 's march economic update on 13 march .
the statement will have `` no red box , no official document , no spending increases , no tax changes '' and will last 15-20 minutes , a spokesman said .
instead philip hammond will simply set out updated uk economic forecasts on that date .
so even less substance than usual !

documents.title: 152 more jobs go at carillion
text: the official receiver reports that 152 more carillion workers will be made redundant and will leave the business later this week .
that brings the total job losses since the company 's collapse to 1,141 .
but the receiver said `` employment has been confirmed for 942 employees '' over the past week bringing the total to date 7,610 .

documents.title: reckitt share price fall deepens
text: reckitt benckiser 's share price fall has deepened since this morning with them now trading almost 7 % lower .
the household products maker , whose brands include durex and dettol , reported flat annual sales for the year .
the share price fall - if it lasts today - will result in its worst day of trading in almost seven years .

`` the return to growth in last quarter should be a positive sign but investors are still a little spooked by the preceding quarters and uncertain about whether management is righting the ship , '' says etx capital analyst neil wilson .

documents.title: pound slips lower
text: much like the gray and rainy weather this morning the pound appears to be feeling a bit lacklustre .
it 's currently lower against both the dollar and euro , slipping 0.09 % to $ 1.40180 against the dollar and 0.12 % to €1.12890 against the euro .
analysts say investors are nervous ahead of official employment data due on wednesday .
`` if we were just to choose one economic data release for sterling , it 's got to be the earnings numbers now , '' said rabobank currency strategist jane foley .
`` the bank of england has hung its hat on the assumption that there will be wage inflation and that brexit will be smooth .
the signal they gave us that they are positioning for a may interest rate hike relies on this assumption , '' she added .

documents.title: mccoll 's shares drop
text: mccoll 's annual results - published this morning - have n't gone down well with investors .
the convenience store chain 's shares initially plunged 11 % , but have since recovered slightly and are now trading 4 % lower .
globaldata analyst molly johnson-jones says the fall is due to mccoll 's warning that the collapse of wholesaler palmer & harvey had hit recent sales .

however , she says she does n't think this will be a long term issue : `` once this disruption subsides , mccoll 's appears on track to continue to grow operating margins above the 2.7 % that it currently achieves . ''

documents.title: game sales reach new level
text: sales of games climbed 2.1 % year-on-year in the last quarter , according to the latest kantar worldwide entertainment barometer .
it reports that enthusiasts spent an extra £ 6.8m over the festive period with amazon benefiting most as it now accounts for one in four gaming purchases .
however hmv retains a 26.8 % market share , beating amazon into second place .

olivia moore , analyst at kantar worldpanel , said : although still experiencing customer losses - almost 37,000 fewer compared to this time last year - sales of games have been bolstered by remaining gamers spending an extra £ 2 on average every time they shop . ''
call of duty : wwii came out on top as gamers ' for the christmas period .

documents.title: oxfam scandal could hit large charities
text: charities could face more stringent monitoring from wealthy donors in the wake of the oxfam scandal , according to tom hall , head of philanthropy services in the uk at ubs .
`` stories like ( oxfam ) reinforce the need to have more rigour around one 's philanthropic investment , particularly at the higher end , '' he told the financial times .

stricter due diligence in the sector could particularly hit large charities , which according to the paper receive almost half of the sector 's income while making up just 1 % of charitable organisations in the uk .

michael maslinski , a partner at stonehage fleming , told the paper : `` i am absolutely certain that when it comes to reviewing charitable donations , the monitoring criteria are bound to be strengthened . ''

documents.title: jet2 flying high
text: dart group , which owns travel firm jet2 , has said this morning that its full year profit will be `` materially ahead of current market expectations '' .
the group is due to report its full results on 31 march .
it credited `` a more normalised pricing environment '' after heavy discounting for the turnaround .
the upgrade is the second in just a few months after the firm said in november that higher demand for flights had resulted in future bookings being ahead of expectations .
etx capital analyst neil wilson says the performance is largely linked to the failure of rivals .
`` as spare capacity has been removed from the short-haul air and holiday sector , dart is able to benefit .
the loss of monarch , air berlin and alitalia has undoubtedly helped , '' he says .

documents.title: germany 's siemens to list medical unit
text: german industrial group siemens has announced it plans to list its healthineers medical unit in the first half of this year , in what is expected to be germany 's largest stock market listing in over two decades .
the group said it would float `` a meaningful minority share '' in the medical equipment division on the frankfurt stock exchange to `` create a liquid market for the siemens healthineers shares '' .
media reports suggest the flotation could raise up to €9bn , making it germany 's largest listing since deutsche telekom 's €10bn float in 1996 .

documents.title: japan shares start week with a surge
text: tokyo 's main share index jumped 2 % on monday - as the weaker yen and wall street gains encourgaed investors .
the nikkei 225 index added 429 points to close at 22,149.2 with uniqlo owner fast retailing one of the big winners .
however in the region 's other key markets such as hong kong and china , trading remained closed for the lunar new year break .

documents.title: time to nationalise kfc ?
text: the nationwide closure of kentucky fried chicken stores because of a dhl delivery cock-up has led to fed up fans turning to social media .
some simply tweeted angry abuse at the fried chicken chain but one fan wrote into the bristol evening post asking for government intervention .
he said : `` it is time for the government to step in and take urgent measures to secure kfc 's supply chain .
if we can bail out the banks , surely we can support this beloved institution . ''
he asked the paper to invite readers to call on local mps to raise an emergency motion in parliament `` to immediately nationalise kfc to ensure its continued operation . ''
what 's your view of the chicken disaster ?
send your comments to bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: frank field demands arcadia facts from philip green
text: reports topshop boss sir philip green is in talks to sell all or part of his retail empire has prompted chairman of the work and pensions committee frank field to intervene .
mr field , who clashed with sir philip over bhs 's collapse , tells today he will be writing to the firm to `` try and find out what the position is '' over the firm 's pension schemes .
`` the first stage is to try and find the facts , '' he says .
labour mp mr field , whose commons committee last year investigated the sale and subsequent collapse of bhs , has had a long-running feud with sir philip .
asked by business presenter dominic o'connell if this looks like `` a vendetta '' , mr field says `` i hope it does n't '' .
`` we should n't be doing this , '' he says .
instead , he says that the pensions regulator should have the power to call `` a temporary halt '' to any firm 's sale to check the pensions situation .
sir philip 's arcadia group , whose brands also include burton , miss selfridge , dorothy perkins and wallis , has 2,800 stores across the world .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: dividends climbed 3 % in 2017
text: uk companies cautiously raised shareholder payouts last year .
dividends grew just 3 % on a headline basis to £ 68bn in 2017 in britain , according to the latest janus henderson global dividend index .
but that marked a rebound following a 3.5 % drop a year earlier .

the `` relatively modest '' increase reflected a large number of companies falling out of a ranking of the most valuable 1,200 firms based on market valuation following the post-brexit vote collapse of sterling .

`` sterling remained sharply lower against the dollar in the first half of the year , and its recovery in the second half was not enough to prevent an exchange rate loss for the year overall , '' the report said .

documents.title: reckitt shares slump on flat earnings
text: shares in household goods giant reckitt benckiser have fallen 2.8 % or 183p to 6,385p after it posted flat revenue figures today .
the durex-to-dettol company reported full year revenue figures of £ 11.5bn , although total reported growth was 21 % .
meanwhile analysts at liberium have rated the company as a buy with an 8,000 target price .

documents.title: mccoll 's sees £ 1bn sales for first time
text: convenience chain mccoll 's has passed the £ 1bn sales mark for the first time , following its acquisition of 298 co-op stores last year .
total revenues rose almost a fifth to £ 1.13bn for its 2017 financial year .
chief executive jonathan miller says the business was now one of `` real scale '' .

like-for-like sales , which strip out new store openings , however were up just 0.1 % and the group said it had been hit by disruption due to major uk wholesaler palmer and harvey ( p & h ) falling into administration in november .
mccoll 's said total like-for-like sales for the 11 weeks until 11 february were down 2.2 % , with its performance `` held back '' by sales in stores formerly supplied by p & h .

documents.title: ftse 100 opens slightly up
text: the ftse 100 opened up 0.14 % at 7,304.95 this morning .
that follows friday 's 0.83 % rise .

documents.title: n brown gets new chair
text: n brown , which owns plus-size clothing brands jacamo , simply be and marisota , has appointed a new chairman from tesco .
matt davies - currently chief executive of tesco uk - will take up the role on 1 may .
he will take over from andrew higginson who is retiring .
angela spindler ( is the firm 's group chief executive and mr davies says his aim will be to work with her and fellow directors to help grow the business .

documents.title: switzerland 's 'strange economic tale '
text: `` one of the stranger economic tales of recent times '' is how today business presenter dominic o'connell describes the actions of switzerland 's central bank .
the bank has n't just kept on inflation in check , it 's now on track to make a profit of $ 55bn ( £ 39bn ) this year .

swiss national bank chairman thomas jordan tells today : `` our mandate is price stability and maintaining price stability but also taking into account the business cycle we were forced to intervene , '' he said .
mr jordan says its actions were n't because the bank wanted to make money but because they were desperate to stop the swiss franc appreciating in value against other currencies .
despite the bank 's expected high profits , mr jordan says it will only transfer $ 1bn or $ 2bn ( £ 0.7bn to £ 1.4bn ) maximum to the government .
`` we know they [ the profits ] are very volatile , so we have to be very careful .
the rest is maintained as capital in the bank to absorb future losses especially from exchange rate shocks , '' he says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: saga pays new chairman £ 325,000
text: over-50s insurer saga has appointed a new chairman to take over in april .
patrick o'sullivan has been chairman of old mutual since 2010 and was formerly at zurich insurance , bank of america , goldman sachs and barclays .
he 'll trouser £ 325,000 for the new role when he takes over from existing chairman andrew goodsell .

documents.title: reckitt has 'solid ' end to year
text: household products giant reckitt benckiser , whose products include nurofen and dettol , says it has had a `` solid end to the year '' .
the firm paid a whopping $ 17.9bn ( £ 12.8bn ) for baby formula maker mead johnson last year .
it said the integration of the division was on track with the company growing again after nine consecutive quarters of losses .
overall for the firm like-for-like sales , which strip out sales from new divisions , rose 2 % in the fourth quarter and were flat for the year as a whole .
net income , excluding discontinued operations , rose 4 % .

documents.title: 'i was made redundant on maternity leave '
text: sara rees from cardiff had been on maternity leave from a large charity for three months with her first child when she tried to contact her employer to discuss her return .
her emails were ignored and she also realised she had been removed from the list of staff on her company 's website .
she eventually received a letter telling her she had been made redundant .
ms rees has since set up a social enterprise which supports women who want to get back into work and says her story is n't uncommon .
she tells the today programme that women need to join a union and know their rights .

a poll for the equality and human rights commission ( ehrc ) , published this morning shows many employers needed more support to better understand the basics of discrimination law and the rights of pregnant women and new mothers .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: where are markets going ?
text: markets seemed generally settled last week after the big correction which saw stock markets fall around the world .
but richard dunbar , investment director at aberdeen standard , says investors are still nervous and that it 's not time to relax yet .
`` be careful , '' he advises today programme listeners .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: restaurant trade running into trouble ?
text: celebrity chef jamie oliver is considering selling his barbecoa steakhouses , his company confirmed on sunday .
the move comes after the jamie oliver restaurant group announced in january that it was shutting down 12 of its 37 jamie 's italian restaurants .
law firm moore stephens has calculated that insolvencies in the restaurant trade are up 20 % .
but simon fowles , a partner at the firm , tells the today programme that there 's still a market for these types of restaurant .
`` they 're not going anywhere , '' he says .
mr fowles blames tough market conditions , the increase in the national minimum wage and the drop in sterling for driving restaurants ' costs higher .
but he believes that most will still survive after restructuring .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: asian shares show slight gains
text: asian shares gained today , joining a global recovery for equity markets as sentiment improves gradually .
msci 's broadest index of asia-pacific shares outside japan rose 0.5 % , having recovered more than 40 % of their losses from late last month to last week 's low .
japan 's nikkei gained 1.3 % .

documents.title: pfi profits should face 'windfall tax '
text: the `` enormous '' profits being made by private finance initiative ( pfi ) companies should be subject to a new windfall tax - so much-needed resources can be put back into cash-strapped public services , unison has urged .

the union said such a tax could be introduced if two amendments to the finance bill , which have been tabled by labour mp stella creasy , achieve enough support during wednesday 's house of commons debate on the draft legislation .

unison said it believes a new windfall tax could prove a `` lifeline '' to under pressure public services and would force pfi firms to pay back some of the billions of pounds they 've made `` at taxpayers ' expense '' .

documents.title: businesses 'decades behind the law '
text: `` many businesses attitudes are decades behind the law and appear to just ignore the rights of pregnant women and mothers at work , '' sue coe , head of employment at the equality and human rights commission told wake up to money .
she was discussing the commission 's report published this morning that firms in 'dark ages ' over women workers .
`` we want employers to put a stake in the ground to eliminate pregnancy and maternity discrimination by joining our working forward initiative which helps employers improve their practice . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live
Wake Up To Money

documents.title: oil climbing again
text: oil prices have extended gains to hit their highest level in nearly two weeks .
prices have been buoyed as asian shares joined a global recovery in equity markets and by worries over tensions in the middle east .
london brent crude lcoc1 was up 46 cents , or 0.7 % , at $ 65.30 , after rising more than 3 % last week .

text: welcome to today 's business live where we 'll be bringing you the latest news across the business world .
there 'll be final results from mccoll 's and reckitt benckiser and interim figures from petra diamonds and william hill .
it 's london fashion week so we 'll be keeping a close on on any business stories emerging from that .
